alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Clay; Lewis; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Northwest Webster; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 5:36AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Gusty showers will impact portions of Randolph, northern Pocahontas, southeastern Taylor, north central Nicholas, southeastern Lewis, eastern Braxton, Upshur, Webster, east central Clay and Barbour Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 535 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Terra Alta to near Birch River. Movement was east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Philippi, Sutton, Audra State Park, Greenbank, Webster Springs, Cass Scenic Railroad, Belington, Gassaway, Addison (Webster Springs), Mill Creek, Snowshoe, Dailey, Birch River, Holly River State Park, Rock Cave, Harrison, Mingo and Beverly. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 53 and 69. Route 19 between mile markers 50 and 68. Route 33 between mile markers 15 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
